revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Sagemcom |model=F@ST 2504 |revision=n (v.6) |availability=discontinued 2012 |type=wireless router,dsl modem |fcc_id= |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=0.7 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM6362 |cpu1_cspeed=400 |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L6405D |ram1=64 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |serial= |jtag= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM6362 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags=ADSL2+ |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} The Sagem F@ST2504n router used to be distributed :by '''Sky''' to their UK broadband customers.
*[https://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/sagem/sagem_fast2504n_v.6 ''Sagemcom F@ST 2504n v.6'' on '''OpenWrt''' Wiki] :Per [http://wiki.ph-mb.com/wiki/FAST2504n this Wiki], the device uses BCM6362.. :but it probably uses BCM6361 :(basically identical.. but no DECT functionality).
